title: Recent Appreciation in the U.S. Dollar Unlikely to Have Large Effect on Domestic Inflation
description: The U.S. dollar has appreciated more than 8.5 percent since May 2021, raising questions about potential effects on domestic inflation. If imports are billed in foreign currencies, then a strong dollar could reduce import prices and therefore domestic inflation. However, U.S. imports are almost entirely invoiced in U.S. dollars, dampening this effect. We find that the recent appreciation in the U.S. dollar has a negligible effect on domestic inflation as measured by the core price index for personal consumption expenditures.
dc:creator: Sattiraju, Sai; Matschke, Johannes
dc:subject: Inflation; US dollar
